added stuff

Does this work in 0.90?

For me itÃ‚Â´s not.
In my case its working 100%, together with Astronomer's Edge of Oblivion Pack.

No, the resolution is the same. The trick is not in what information is there, but what information is perceivable. Color creates separation that alpha cannot. Thus I have lowered alpha by bringing the exposure down.

At a low resolution, pixelization lowers the number of light levels in a gradient. Lowering the difference in brightness value between each neighboring pixel makes the gradient appear smoother, without changing any rbg ratios that would bring that same detail to the image.

Besides, at this distance the smaller part of the lens flare is just more than half its actual size.

Awesome, thanks for the info! But if you're lowing the exposure surely it's really dull/dim in game?

Edit - Just deleted citylights because they were glitchy... Now it looks like this. http://i.imgur.com/sxdE1rA.jpg

... That's the shovel from Toolbar, how on earth did it become clouds?! Something's gone terribly wrong...

Edited December 22, 2014 by ObsessedWithKSP

... That's the shovel texture from Toolbar, how on earth did it become clouds?! Something's gone terribly wrong...

haha!! Only in KSP!

This version DOES work with 0.90 Beta. I just installed clouds on Kerbin, Eve, Jool, and Laythe. I have sandstorms on Duna. I added auroras to all of these planets also. I removed city lights without any problems. I also added texture replacer and have visor reflections, alternate space suits and, removed helmets in breathable environments. If you are having problems with this mod you have installed it wrong.

BETA is BEAUTIFUL!!!!!!!

Texture problems with EVE seem to be related to certain texture file types or being real close to the memory limit. Why? I don't know, but if you convert any odd files to DDS or PNG and make sure your memory limit is in check you shouldn't suffer the strange texture issues.

Texture problems with EVE seem to be related to certain texture file types or being real close to the memory limit. Why? I don't know, but if you convert any odd files to DDS or PNG and make sure your memory limit is in check you shouldn't suffer the strange texture issues.

PNG files get ruined by Active Texture Management.

I couldn't use the Glass Panes and Enclosures mod because of that

ATM converts all PNG, etc. texture into .DDS, I believe, and thus destroys most of the stuff possible only with PNG like transparency.

PNG files get ruined by Active Texture Management.

I couldn't use the Glass Panes and Enclosures mod because of that

ATM converts all PNG, etc. texture into .DDS, I believe, and thus destroys most of the stuff possible only with PNG like transparency.

Hold-up here, what textures did you have problems with? ATM shouldn't do anything like that, it preserves alpha.

ATM converts all PNG, etc. texture into .DDS, I believe, and thus destroys most of the stuff possible only with PNG like transparency.

You know KSP also converts PNGs to DDS as well, right? Well, it decompresses it first, then asks Unity to compress it to a DDS (which do support transparency, btw, provided they have the alpha channel correctly preserved).

Hold-up here, what textures did you have problems with? ATM shouldn't do anything like that, it preserves alpha.

Textures from this mod.

After uninstalling ATM, the parts worked fine

You know KSP also converts PNGs to DDS as well, right? Well, it decompresses it first, then asks Unity to compress it to a DDS (which do support transparency, btw, provided they have the alpha channel correctly preserved).
.

ATM does something weird with the same Alpha channel, making transparency impossible. At least that's what I found out, at least for the parts mentioned above.

To be completely honest, this conclusion was made solely from personal experience.

ATM is an awesome mod, and helped me out through heavily-moded procedures.

Originally used the Astronomer Interstellar pack thing, then used standard this thinking it was issue, but nope!

I cannot seem to manage to find the issue, so any help available?

I'm just testing KSP 0.90 x64 on Linux (Ubuntu 14.04) running on a VMware Workstation. Everything runs surprisingly smooth and fine, only problem I ran into so far is this:

Kerbin

Laythe

Basically all planets with cloud layers (Kerbin, Duna, Laythe) are completely covered and white. Tried several things, changing game resolutions and graphic settings, used different cloud resolutions, nothing helped. Anyone any idea? Maybe changing some config files?

I'm just testing KSP 0.90 x64 on Linux (Ubuntu 14.04) running on a VMware Workstation. Everything runs surprisingly smooth and fine, only problem I ran into so far is this:

Kerbin

http://snag.gy/jZGuu.jpg

Laythe

Basically all planets with cloud layers (Kerbin, Duna, Laythe) are completely covered and white. Tried several things, changing game resolutions and graphic settings, used different cloud resolutions, nothing helped. Anyone any idea? Maybe changing some config files?

hello,

i 'had the same problem as you last night, and as a good noob i didn' t saved anything:sealed::

i have installed:

1:Environmental Visual Enhancements 7.4 ,

2: Astronomer's Visual Pack - Interstellar V2: http://kerbal.curseforge.com/ksp-mod...l-pack-v3-beta, i 'have followed all steps, a,d installed everything (in recommended quality) exept: sandstorm,skybox, new sun, holidays season light.

and i had exactly the same kind on the big map of clouds(all white) on the big map in in flight too but it wasn't so ugly, just really cloudy(maybe 70% of the sky) but didn't took printscreen(noob.v2)

So i 've tried to reinstall the interstellar pack: nothing changed.

Suddently i remenbered the installation replaced some .png, and the very helpfull Active-Memory-Reduction-Mod (TextureCompressor) save the compressed images in cache.

so go to the the cache( C:\Program Files\PXG\Kerbal Space Program\GameData\ActiveTextureManagement\textureCache\BoulderCo for me)

and delete everything inside( there is 2 folders inside:citylights and clouds).

lauch the the game and enjoy !! (it can be long to wait the 1st time because active memory reduction have to compress the clouds textures, if it crash reload it until it works).

now i have this:

http://snag.gy/c9Dta.jpg

http://snag.gy/iqyks.jpg

maybe it can help most of us..

________________________________________________________

And I got my other side of Kerbin covered in the new pretty city lights...everywhere.

Also...

YAY FOR OVER-COLONIZATION!
